definition: askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
crooked/not straight/staggering from side to side
crooked/not straight/staggering from side to side
to succeed by a lucky stroke
noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
lit. If the upper beam is not straight, the lower beam will be crooked (idiom); fig. subordinates imitate their superiors' vices
pinyin: shang4 liang2 bu4 zheng4 xia4 liang2 wai1

sentences.english: But sometimes, ISP's and mail service businesses have no interest in righting what went wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但有时，互联网的业务和邮件服务没有兴趣纠正想歪。

sentences.english: His face twisted in a grin.
His face was contorted with anger.
When he saw her, his face puckered and he began to cry, holding up a grubby bruised finger.
sentences.chinese: 他一看见她，就歪着脸举着一个受伤的指头哭起来了。

sentences.english: CKCMC is located in the State of Perak Manjung County.
sentences.chinese: 莫珍歪卫理公会是位于在霹雳州的曼隆县。

sentences.english: Again under the cherry tree came the little figure of Tim who was playing the violin with his head tilted.
sentences.chinese: 樱桃树下又出现了蒂姆歪着脑袋拉琴的小小身影。

sentences.english: Mother Cotton-Tail began to make cookies and Tippy Toes rolled them out for her.
sentences.chinese: 棉尾巴妈妈开始做饼干，歪脚趾负责帮她把饼干擀平。

sentences.english: After the guarantee welding the connection position does not appear crooked.
sentences.chinese: 保证焊接后接驳位不出现歪扭。

sentences.english: Hertzog's mouth formed a soft but twisted smile .
sentences.chinese: 赫佐格的嘴形成了一个浅浅的，但是歪扭的微笑。

sentences.english: It came out as more of a grimace.
sentences.chinese: 它出来如一个面部的歪扭更多。

sentences.english: Tippy Toes did not say he was going to stop and see Bunny and Susan.
sentences.chinese: 歪脚趾没说他这次本来就是要去看巴尼和苏姗的。

sentences.english: She walked slow, with her hands in her pockets and her head to one side.
sentences.chinese: 她走得很慢，手插在口袋里，歪着脑袋。

sentences.english: It is no use to blame the looking glass if your face is awry.
sentences.chinese: 假如你的脸是长歪的，责怪镜子是没有用的。

sentences.english: The children tipped the table and the glasses fell off.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们弄歪桌子，玻璃杯都掉到地上了。

sentences.english: His nose is out of joint for not being invited.
sentences.chinese: 他没有受到邀请，鼻子都气歪了。

sentences.english: You are wearing your hat crooked.

definition: confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to protrude/to stick out/to pout (also written 噘)/to embarrass (people)
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
to draw back the corners of one's mouth
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
